thread.title: Texas A&M's Merchant Reviewed PCT's New Distance Learning Center
thread.title_full: Texas A&M's Merchant Reviewed PCT's New Distance Learning Center

title: Texas A&M's Merchant Reviewed PCT's New Distance Learning Center
text:
Subscribe Texas A&M's Merchant Reviewed PCT's New Distance Learning Center Merchant wrote that the courses offer “a great way to hone your skills and make sure your technicians know pesticide labels as well as if they had helped write them.” October 8, 2015 
Mike Merchant, entomology specialist for Texas AgriLife Extension and Insects in the City blogger, recently had an opportunity to review PCT's new Distance Learning Center, the centerpiece of which is the new online label training program . Created by Board Certified Entomologist and consultant Stoy Hedges, the courses use photographs, video clips and reference materials to challenge users’ knowledge, experience and problem-solving skills for a wide range of products and pest problems. Merchant wrote that the courses offer “a great way to hone your skills and make sure your technicians know pesticide labels as well as if they had helped write them.” Read Merchant’s blog posting here . Suspend Polyzone Modules Added to PCT’s DLC Label Training Program October 5, 2015 
PCT’s Distance Learning Center continues to expand with the addition of a two-part label training module for Bayer’s Suspend Polyzone. Visit https://training.pctonline.com and get started on the... Read More Texas A&M Announces Free Webinar on Managing Cockroaches and Ants September 28, 2015 
Learn practical tips for preventing problems associated with cockroaches and ants in webinar from Texas A&M's Wizzie Brown, on Oct. 2. Read More Label Training For a New Generation of PMPs September 8, 2015 
PCT’s groundbreaking Distance Learning Center features state-of-the-art Label Training, an area where knowledge is critical yet specific product training is lacking. Read More The Pulse
